title: William Shakespeare
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 485 words, Level L (Grade 2), Lexile 630L

description: William Shakespeare is considered one of the greatest writers who ever lived. His ability to write about the depth of shared human experience is said to be unmatched. In William Shakespeare, students are introduced to the fascinating life of and body of work created by this extraordinary writer. The book can also be used to teach students how to distinguish fact and opinion and to identify and use names of people as proper nouns. The book and lesson are also available for levels I and O.
